intro: Ardisia verapazensis subsp. cucullata, commonly known as the Verapaz arrowwood, is a shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. Its fruits are bright red berries, which are an important food source for various bird species. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf shape and habitat preferences in moist, shaded forest environments.
